dmca.title: Copyright Infringment By ThePlanet website
dmca.body:
Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

 

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal
<http://www.theplanet.com/legal> .

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


________________________________

From: David H. Kaplan [mailto:dhkaplan@comcast.net] 
Posted At: Tuesday, October 10, 2006 8:06 PM
Posted To: Legal Response
Conversation: Copyright Infringment By ThePlanet website
Subject: Copyright Infringment By ThePlanet website



Gentlemen:

 

Upon advice of counsel, I would like to advise you of copyright
infringement by one of the sites you host:
http://www.gableconstruction.com <http://www.gableconstruction.com/>  .

 

Specifically, on the page http://www.gableconstruction.com/resi.html a
picture I took is shown at the bottom entitled "Craftsman Art Project".

 

Further, if you follow the link to
http://www.gableconstruction.com/resi_cap.html all these are pictures I
took of our house, and thus own the copyright to them. I had given Gable
Construction copies of these pictures for the purpose of maintaining a
history of the construction they were performing.

 

At no time did I ever give them verbal or written permission to use them
for any other purpose, and would never consider doing so.

 

According to the legal section on your own website: 

"Intellectual Property Infringement Policy

Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or
otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or work
that infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet
has the right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the
extent required under any law or regulation, including the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998"

I hereby request that you follow your stated policy and enforce the
removal of these pictures from their site.

 

Thank you for your assistance.

 

Sincerely,

 

 

David H. Kaplan

36 Drumlin Rd.

West Simsbury, CT 06092

860-658-5433

 

C: Atty. Mark Porto, Esq.
